title: Configuration
description:
The configuration for the router.

Can be created through `serde::Deserialize` from various formats, or inline in Rust code with `serde_json::json!` and `serde_json::from_value`.

AWSSigV4HardcodedConfig.description: Hardcoded Config using access_key and secret. Prefer using DefaultChain instead.

access_key_id.description: The ID for this access key.

region.description: The AWS region this chain applies to.

secret_access_key.description: The secret key used to sign requests.

service_name.description: The service you're trying to access, eg: "s3", "vpc-lattice-svcs", etc.

ApolloMetricsReferenceMode.description: Apollo usage report reference generation modes.

oneOf.description: Use the extended mode to report input object fields and enum value references as well as object fields.
Use the standard mode that only reports referenced object fields.

ApolloSignatureNormalizationAlgorithm.description: Apollo usage report signature normalization algorithm

oneOf.description: Use the algorithm that matches the JavaScript-based implementation.
Use a new algorithm that includes input object forms, normalized aliases and variable names, and removes some edge cases from the JS implementation that affected normalization.

enabled.description: Activates Automatic Persisted Queries (enabled by default)

external_id.description: Unique identifier that might be required when you assume a role in another account.

role_arn.description: Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the role assumed when making requests

session_name.description: Uniquely identify a session when the same role is assumed by different principals or for different reasons.

max_concurrent_exports.description:
Maximum number of concurrent exports

Limits the number of spawned tasks for exports and thus memory consumed by an exporter. A value of 1 will cause exports to be performed synchronously on the BatchSpanProcessor task. The default is 1.

max_export_batch_size.description: The maximum number of spans to process in a single batch. If there are more than one batch worth of spans then it processes multiple batches of spans one batch after the other without any delay. The default value is 512.

max_export_timeout.description: The maximum duration to export a batch of data. The default value is 30 seconds.

max_queue_size.description: The maximum queue size to buffer spans for delayed processing. If the queue gets full it drops the spans. The default value of is 2048.

scheduled_delay.description: The delay interval in milliseconds between two consecutive processing of batches. The default value is 5 seconds.

enabled.description: Activates Batching (disabled by default)

oneOf.description: batch_http_link

CSRFConfig.description:
CSRF protection configuration.

See <https://owasp.org/www-community/attacks/csrf> for an explanation on CSRF attacks.

required_headers.description: Override the headers to check for by setting custom_headers Note that if you set required_headers here, you may also want to have a look at your `CORS` configuration, and make sure you either: - did not set any `allow_headers` list (so it defaults to `mirror_request`) - added your required headers to the allow_headers list, as shown in the `examples/cors-and-csrf/custom-headers.router.yaml` files.

unsafe_disabled.description:
The CSRF plugin is enabled by default.

Setting `unsafe_disabled: true` *disables* CSRF protection.

path.description: Specify on which path you want to listen for callbacks (default: /callback)

public_url.description: URL used to access this router instance, including the path configured on the Router

subgraphs.description: Specify on which subgraph we enable the callback mode for subscription If empty it applies to all subgraphs (passthrough mode takes precedence)

Chaos.description: Configuration for chaos testing, trying to reproduce bugs that require uncommon conditions. You probably donâ€™t want this in production!

force_reload.description: Force a hot reload of the Router (as if the schema or configuration had changed) at a regular time interval.

CommonBatchingConfig.description: Common options for configuring subgraph batching

enabled.description: Whether this batching config should be enabled

url.description: The url you'd like to offload processing to

main.description: The main entry point for Rhai script evaluation

scripts.description: The directory where Rhai scripts can be found

Config.description: Configuration options pertaining to the health component.

enabled.description: Set to false to disable the health check

path.description: Optionally set a custom healthcheck path Defaults to /health

Config10.description: Configuration for exposing errors that originate from subgraphs

subgraphs.description: Overrides global configuration on a per-subgraph basis

enabled.description: Enable or disable the entity caching feature

Config12.description: Configuration for the progressive override plugin

buffer_size.description: The buffer size for sending traces to Apollo. Increase this if you are experiencing lost traces.

client_name_header.description: The name of the header to extract from requests when populating 'client name' for traces and metrics in Apollo Studio.

client_version_header.description: The name of the header to extract from requests when populating 'client version' for traces and metrics in Apollo Studio.

endpoint.description: The Apollo Studio endpoint for exporting traces and metrics.

experimental_local_field_metrics.description: Enable field metrics that are generated without FTV1 to be sent to Apollo Studio.

experimental_otlp_endpoint.description: The Apollo Studio endpoint for exporting traces and metrics.

enabled.description: Enable otlp
Set to true to enable

path.description: The path where prometheus will be exposed

enabled.description: Enable zipkin

enable_span_mapping.description: Enable datadog span mapping for span name and resource name.

enabled.description: Enable datadog

fixed_span_names.description: Fixes the span names, this means that the APM view will show the original span names in the operation dropdown.

resource_mapping.description: Custom mapping to be used as the resource field in spans, defaults to: router -> http.route supergraph -> graphql.operation.name query_planning -> graphql.operation.name subgraph -> subgraph.name subgraph_request -> subgraph.name http_request -> http.route

span_metrics.description: Which spans will be eligible for span stats to be collected for viewing in the APM view. Defaults to true for `request`, `router`, `query_parsing`, `supergraph`, `execution`, `query_planning`, `subgraph`, `subgraph_request`, `connect`, `connect_request` and `http_request`.

Config18.description: Configuration for the experimental traffic shaping plugin

deduplicate_variables.description: DEPRECATED, now always enabled: Enable variable deduplication optimization when sending requests to subgraphs (https://github.com/apollographql/router/issues/87)

Config2.description: Configuration for operation limits, parser limits, HTTP limits, etc.

http1_max_request_buf_size.description:
Limit the maximum buffer size for the HTTP1 connection.

Default is ~400kib.

http1_max_request_headers.description:
Limit the maximum number of headers of incoming HTTP1 requests. Default is 100.

If router receives more headers than the buffer size, it responds to the client with "431 Request Header Fields Too Large".

http_max_request_bytes.description: Limit the size of incoming HTTP requests read from the network, to protect against running out of memory. Default: 2000000 (2 MB)

introspection_max_depth.description: Limit the depth of nested list fields in introspection queries to protect avoid generating huge responses. Returns a GraphQL error with `{ message: "Maximum introspection depth exceeded" }` when nested fields exceed the limit. Default: true

max_aliases.description: If set, requests with operations with more aliases than this maximum are rejected with a HTTP 400 Bad Request response and GraphQL error with `"extensions": {"code": "MAX_ALIASES_LIMIT"}`

max_depth.description:
If set, requests with operations deeper than this maximum are rejected with a HTTP 400 Bad Request response and GraphQL error with `"extensions": {"code": "MAX_DEPTH_LIMIT"}`

Counts depth of an operation, looking at its selection sets,Ë› including fields in fragments and inline fragments. The following example has a depth of 3.

```graphql query getProduct { book { # 1 ...bookDetails } }

fragment bookDetails on Book { details { # 2 ... on ProductDetailsBook { country # 3 } } } ```

max_height.description:
If set, requests with operations higher than this maximum are rejected with a HTTP 400 Bad Request response and GraphQL error with `"extensions": {"code": "MAX_DEPTH_LIMIT"}`

Height is based on simple merging of fields using the same name or alias, but only within the same selection set. For example `name` here is only counted once and the query has height 3, not 4:

```graphql query { name { first } name { last } } ```

This may change in a future version of Apollo Router to do [full field merging across fragments][merging] instead.

[merging]: https://spec.graphql.org/October2021/#sec-Field-Selection-Merging]

max_root_fields.description:
If set, requests with operations with more root fields than this maximum are rejected with a HTTP 400 Bad Request response and GraphQL error with `"extensions": {"code": "MAX_ROOT_FIELDS_LIMIT"}`

This limit counts only the top level fields in a selection set, including fragments and inline fragments.

parser_max_recursion.description: Limit recursion in the GraphQL parser to protect against stack overflow. default: 500

parser_max_tokens.description: Limit the number of tokens the GraphQL parser processes before aborting.

warn_only.description: If set to true (which is the default is dev mode), requests that exceed a `max_*` limit are *not* rejected. Instead they are executed normally, and a warning is logged.

Config3.description: This is a broken plugin for testing purposes only.

enabled.description: Enable the broken plugin.
Enable the restricted plugin (for testing purposes only)

subgraphs.description: Create a configuration that will apply only to a specific subgraph.

sources.description: Create a configuration that will apply only to a specific source.

connector_http_request_header.description: The name of a connector HTTP request header.

connector_http_response_header.description: The name of a connector HTTP response header.

oneOf.description: The name of the connector source.

debug_extensions.description: Enables connector debugging information on response extensions if the feature is enabled

expose_sources_in_context.description: When enabled, adds an entry to the context for use in coprocessors ```json { "context": { "entries": { "apollo_connectors::sources_in_query_plan": [ { "subgraph_name": "subgraph", "source_name": "source" } ] } } } ```

max_requests_per_operation_per_source.description: The maximum number of requests for a connector source

preview_connect_v0_2.description: Feature gate for connect spec v0.2. Set to `true` to enable the using the v0.2 spec during the preview phase.

sources.description: Map of subgraph_name.connector_source_name to source configuration

subgraphs.description: A map of subgraph name to connectors config for that subgraph

allow_any_origin.description:
Set to true to allow any origin.

Defaults to false Having this set to true is the only way to allow Origin: null.

allow_credentials.description: Set to true to add the `Access-Control-Allow-Credentials` header.

allow_headers.description:
The headers to allow.

If this value is not set, the router will mirror client's `Access-Control-Request-Headers`.

Note that if you set headers here, you also want to have a look at your `CSRF` plugins configuration, and make sure you either: - accept `x-apollo-operation-name` AND / OR `apollo-require-preflight` - defined `csrf` required headers in your yml configuration, as shown in the `examples/cors-and-csrf/custom-headers.router.yaml` files.

expose_headers.description: Which response headers should be made available to scripts running in the browser, in response to a cross-origin request.

match_origins.description: `Regex`es you want to match the origins against to determine if they're allowed. Defaults to an empty list. Note that `origins` will be evaluated before `match_origins`

max_age.description: The `Access-Control-Max-Age` header value in time units

methods.description: Allowed request methods. Defaults to GET, POST, OPTIONS.

origins.description: The origin(s) to allow requests from. Defaults to `https://studio.apollographql.com/` for Apollo Studio.

oneOf.description: The estimated cost of the operation using the currently configured cost model
The actual cost of the operation using the currently configured cost model
The delta between the estimated and actual cost of the operation using the currently configured cost model
The result of the cost calculation. This is the error code returned by the cost calculation.

enabled.description: Enable subgraph subscription deduplication. When enabled, multiple identical requests to the same subgraph will share one WebSocket connection in passthrough mode. (default: true)

ignored_headers.description: List of headers to ignore for deduplication. Even if these headers are different, the subscription request is considered identical. For example, if you forward the "User-Agent" header, but the subgraph doesn't depend on the value of that header, adding it to this list will let the router dedupe subgraph subscriptions even if the header value is different.

oneOf.description: No default attributes set on spans, you have to set it one by one in the configuration to enable some attributes
Attributes that are marked as required in otel semantic conventions and apollo documentation will be included (default)
Attributes that are marked as required or recommended in otel semantic conventions and apollo documentation will be included

profile_name.description: The profile name used by this provider

region.description: The AWS region this chain applies to.

service_name.description: The service you're trying to access, eg: "s3", "vpc-lattice-svcs", etc.

enabled.description: Enable demand control

dry_run.description: generates the authorization error messages without modying the query

enabled.description: enables the `@authenticated` and `@requiresScopes` directives

reject_unauthorized.description: refuse a query entirely if any part would be filtered

oneOf.description: Only query for `A` (IPv4) records
Only query for `AAAA` (IPv6) records
Query for both `A` (IPv4) and `AAAA` (IPv6) records in parallel
Query for `AAAA` (IPv6) records first; if that fails, query for `A` (IPv4) records
Default: Query for `A` (IPv4) records first; if that fails, query for `AAAA` (IPv6) records

send.description: Send subgraph errors to Apollo Studio

anyOf.description: Deny specific extension keys with required redact_message

redact_message.description: redact error messages for all subgraphs

ErrorRedactionPolicy.description: Allow some error fields to be send to Apollo Studio even when `redact` is true.

oneOf.description: Applies redaction to all error details.
Modifies the `redact` setting by excluding the `extensions.code` field in errors from redaction.
The error reason

Log the event on response

Log the event on error

Simply drop the metrics matching this view

allowed_attribute_keys.description:
An allow-list of attribute keys that will be preserved for the instrument.

Any attribute recorded for the instrument with a key not in this set will be dropped. If the set is empty, all attributes will be dropped, if `None` all attributes will be kept.

separate_per_type.description: Adds the entity type name to attributes. This can greatly increase the cardinality

MultipartRequest.description:
Configuration for a multipart request for file uploads.

This protocol conforms to [jaydenseric's multipart spec](https://github.com/jaydenseric/graphql-multipart-request-spec)

enabled.description: Whether to enable the multipart protocol for file uploads (default: true)

MultipartRequestLimits.description: Request limits for a multipart request

max_file_size.description: The maximum size of each file, in bytes (default: 5MB)

max_files.description: The maximum amount of files allowed for a single query (default: 4)

MultipartRequestMode.description: Supported mode for a multipart request

oneOf.description:
The multipart request will not be loaded into memory and instead will be streamed directly to the subgraph in the order received. This has some limitations, mainly that the query _must_ be able to be streamed directly to the subgraph without buffering.

In practice, this means that certain queries will fail due to ordering of the files.
Send all context keys to coprocessor

Only send the list of context keys to coprocessor

enabled.description: Activates Persisted Queries (disabled by default)

hot_reload.description: Enables hot reloading of the local persisted query manifests

local_manifests.description: Enables using a local copy of the persisted query manifest to safelist operations

log_unknown.description: Enabling this field configures the router to log any freeform GraphQL request that is not in the persisted query list

PersistedQueriesPrewarmQueryPlanCache.description: Persisted Queries (PQ) query plan cache prewarm configuration

on_reload.description: Enabling this field uses the persisted query list to pre-warm the query planner cache on schema and config changes (enabled by default)

on_startup.description: Enabling this field uses the persisted query list to pre-warm the query planner cache on startup (disabled by default)

enabled.description: Enables using the persisted query list as a safelist (disabled by default)

require_id.description: Enabling this field configures the router to reject any request that does not include the persisted query ID

namespace.description: namespace used to prefix Redis keys

password.description: Redis password if not provided in the URLs. This field takes precedence over the password in the URL

pool_size.description: The size of the Redis connection pool

required_to_start.description: Prevents the router from starting if it cannot connect to Redis

reset_ttl.description: When a TTL is set on a key, reset it when reading the data from that key

urls.description: List of URLs to the Redis cluster

username.description: Redis username if not provided in the URLs. This field takes precedence over the username in the URL

experimental_paths_limit.description:
Before creating query plans, for each path of fields in the query we compute all the possible options to traverse that path via the subgraphs. Multiple options can arise because fields in the path can be provided by multiple subgraphs, and abstract types (i.e. unions and interfaces) returned by fields sometimes require the query planner to traverse through each constituent object type. The number of options generated in this computation can grow large if the schema or query are sufficiently complex, and that will increase the time spent planning.

This config allows specifying a per-path limit to the number of options considered. If any path's options exceeds this limit, query planning will abort and the operation will fail.

The default value is None, which specifies no limit.

experimental_plans_limit.description:
Sets a limit to the number of generated query plans. The planning process generates many different query plans as it explores the graph, and the list can grow large. By using this limit, we prevent that growth and still get a valid query plan, but it may not be the optimal one.

The default limit is set to 10000, but it may change in the future

experimental_reuse_query_plans.description: If cache warm up is configured, this will allow the router to keep a query plan created with the old schema, if it determines that the schema update does not affect the corresponding query

warmed_up_queries.description: Warms up the cache on reloads by running the query plan over a list of the most used queries (from the in memory cache) Configures the number of queries warmed up. Defaults to 1/3 of the in memory cache

capacity.description: Number of log lines allowed in interval per message

enabled.description: Set to true to limit the rate of log messages

ReadinessConfig.description: Configuration options pertaining to the readiness health sub-component.

allowed.description: How many rejections are allowed in an interval (default: 100) If this number is exceeded, the router will start to report unready.

ReadinessIntervalConfig.description: Configuration options pertaining to the readiness health interval sub-component.

enabled.description: The recording plugin is disabled by default.

storage_path.description: The path to the directory where recordings will be stored. Defaults to the current working directory.

StrategyConfig.description: Algorithm for calculating the cost of an incoming query.

oneOf.description:
A simple, statically-defined cost mapping for operations and types.

Operation costs: - Mutation: 10 - Query: 0 - Subscription 0

Type costs: - Object: 1 - Interface: 1 - Union: 1 - Scalar: 0 - Enum: 0

list_size.description: The assumed length of lists returned by the operation.

enabled.description: Enable subscription

max_opened_subscriptions.description: This is a limit to only have maximum X opened subscriptions at the same time. By default if it's not set there is no limit.

queue_capacity.description: It represent the capacity of the in memory queue to know how many events we can keep in a buffer

Supergraph.description: Configuration options pertaining to the supergraph server component.

connection_shutdown_timeout.description: The timeout for shutting down connections during a router shutdown or a schema reload.

defer_support.description: Set to false to disable defer support

early_cancel.description: abort request handling when the client drops the connection. Default: false. When set to true, some parts of the request pipeline like telemetry will not work properly, but request handling will stop immediately when the client connection is closed.

experimental_log_on_broken_pipe.description: Log a message if the client closes the connection before the response is sent. Default: false.

generate_query_fragments.description: Enable QP generation of fragments for subgraph requests Default: true

path.description: The HTTP path on which GraphQL requests will be served. default: "/"

SupergraphRequestConf.description: What information is passed to a router request/response stage

SupergraphResponseConf.description: What information is passed to a router request/response stage

query_variable.description: The name of a graphql query variable.

request_header.description: The name of the request header.

response_header.description: The name of the response header.

response_data.description: The supergraph response body json path of the chunks.

response_errors.description: The supergraph response body json path of the chunks.

baggage.description: The name of the baggage item.

env.description: The name of the environment variable

anyOf.description: Deprecated, should not be used anymore, use static field instead

on_graphql_error.description: Boolean set to true if the response body contains graphql error

anyOf.description: Boolean returning true if it's the primary response and not events like subscription events or deferred responses

is_primary_response.description: Boolean returning true if it's the primary response and not events like subscription events or deferred responses

oneOf.description: Export cumulative metrics.
Export delta metrics. `Delta` should be used when exporting to DataDog Agent.

display_current_span.description: Include the current span in this log event.

display_filename.description: Include the filename with the log event.

display_line_number.description: Include the line number with the log event.

display_resource.description: Include the resource with the log event. (default: true)

display_span_id.description: Include the span id (if any) with the log event. (default: true)

display_span_list.description: Include all of the containing span information with the log event. (default: true)

display_target.description: Include the target with the log event. (default: true)

display_thread_id.description: Include the thread_id with the log event.

display_thread_name.description: Include the thread_name with the log event.

display_timestamp.description: Include the timestamp with the log event. (default: true)

span_attributes.description: List of span attributes to attach to the json log object
